articles.author: DAN MERICA, GARANCE BURKE and ALI SWENSON
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — With the 2024 election looming, the first since the mass popularization of generative artificial intelligence, experts feared the worst: social media flooded with AI-generated deepfakes that were so realistic, baffled voters wouldn’t know what to believe.
articles.title: AI is helping shape the 2024 presidential race. But not in the way experts feared

articles.author: SEJAL GOVINDARAO
articles.description: PHOENIX (AP) — The Arizona Supreme Court unanimously ruled Friday that nearly 98,000 people whose citizenship documents hadn’t been confirmed can vote in state and local races, a significant decision that could influence ballot measures and tight legislative races.
articles.title: Court rules nearly 98,000 Arizonans whose citizenship hadn't been confirmed can vote the full ballot

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike in Beirut killed at least 14 people and wounded dozens more, Lebanese health officials said.
articles.title: Israel-Hamas war latest: Israel strikes Beirut after Hezbollah rockets land in northern Israel

articles.author: ELLEN KNICKMEYER and MATTHEW LEE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Biden administration is taking a more hands-off approach than usual during a week of dramatic escalation between Israel and Hezbollah militants in Lebanon, with top U.S.
articles.title: The US is more hands-off than usual in the Middle East. It fears making things worse

articles.author: JAMEY KEATEN and KAREEM CHEHAYEB
articles.description: GENEVA (AP) — Human rights advocates are calling for an independent investigation into the deadly explosions of pagers and walkie-talkies in Lebanon and Syria, suggesting the blasts may have violated international law if the devices were fashioned as booby traps.
articles.title: Did Middle East device attack violate international law? Advocates want an investigation

articles.author: DIANE JEANTET
articles.description: AVIGNON, France (AP) — The trial of dozens of men accused of raping an unconscious woman whose husband repeatedly drugged her over the course of nearly a decade has highlighted the difficulties that sexual violence victims can face in France.
articles.title: Shocking rape trial highlights the systematic struggles French sexual abuse victims face

articles.author: KRISHAN FRANCIS, SHEIKH SAALIQ and BHARATHA MALLAWARACHI
articles.description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka (AP) — Sri Lankans began voting Saturday in a presidential election that will determine the course of the country's recovery from its worst economic crisis and resulting political upheaval.
articles.title: Sri Lankans vote in a presidential election that will decide how it recovers from economic crisis

articles.author: NINIEK KARMINI and CHARLOTTE GRAHAM-McLAY
articles.description: JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) — The New Zealand pilot who’s been held hostage for more than a year in the restive Papua region has been freed by separatist rebels, Indonesian authorities said Saturday.
articles.title: Separatist rebels release New Zealand pilot after 19 months in Indonesia's Papua region

articles.author: JEFFREY COLLINS
articles.description: COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) — South Carolina put inmate Freddie Owens to death Friday as the state restarted executions after an unintended 13-year pause because prison officials couldn’t get the drugs needed for lethal injections.
articles.title: South Carolina inmate dies by lethal injection in state’s first execution in 13 years

articles.author: BRUCE SCHREINER and DYLAN LOVAN
articles.description: WHITESBURG, Ky. (AP) — Residents of a tiny Appalachian town struggled Friday to cope with a shooting involving two of its most prominent citizens: a judge who was gunned down in his courthouse chambers and a local sheriff charged with his murder.
articles.title: Tiny Kentucky town is rocked as their sheriff is jailed in the killing of a prominent judge
